current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to award
		  grants to establish, or expand upon, master's degree or doctoral degree
		  programs in orthotics and prosthetics, and for other purposes.

text.#text:
demonstration of
			 a willingness and ability to participate in a partnership described in

a commitment, and
			 demonstration of an ability, to maintain an accredited orthotics and
			 prosthetics education program after the end of the grant period.

An eligible institution awarded a grant under this
			 section shall use grant amounts to carry out any of the following:

Building new or
			 expanding existing orthotics and prosthetics master’s or doctoral
			 programs.

Training doctoral
			 candidates in fields related to orthotics and prosthetics to prepare them to
			 instruct in orthotics and prosthetics programs.

Training faculty
			 in orthotics and prosthetics education or related fields for the purpose of
			 instruction in orthotics and prosthetics programs.

Salary
			 supplementation for faculty in orthotics and prosthetics education.

Financial aid
			 that allows eligible institutions to admit additional students to study
			 orthotics and prosthetics.

Funding faculty
			 research projects or faculty time to undertake research in the areas of
			 orthotics and prosthetics for the purpose of furthering their teaching
			 abilities.

Renovation of
			 buildings or minor construction to house orthotics and prosthetics education
			 programs.

Purchasing
			 equipment for orthotics and prosthetics education.

An eligible institution awarded a grant under this
			 section may use not more than 50 percent of the grant amount to carry out

An eligible institution awarded a grant under this
			 section shall give preference in admission to the orthotics and prosthetics
			 master’s or doctoral programs to veterans, to the extent practicable.

An eligible institution awarded a grant under this
			 section may use the grant funds for a period of three years after the award of
			 the grant.

In
			 this section:

The eligible institution awarded the grant under this
			 section shall use the grant amount for purposes as follows:

To develop an
			 agenda for orthotics and prosthetics education research.

To fund research
			 in the area of orthotics and prosthetics education.

To publish or
			 otherwise disseminate research findings relating to orthotics and prosthetics
			 education.

The eligible institution awarded the grant under this
			 section may use the grant amount for a period of five years after the award of
			 the grant.
